value.string: **** Header Row - Text for Lookup on Chrome web page obtained from Columns H+ (G is assumed to be All Rules) ****
**** We need the values in an array and this is the only way to do this in AA ****
**** All other rows of the Excel Spreadsheet to be reviewed will have a value under "Fund" ****

value.string: **** In Every Case, Regardless of Outcome, We Will Need to Open the Developer Console *****
[CTRL DOWN][SHIFT DOWN]c[SHIFT UP][CTRL UP][CTRL DOWN][SHIFT DOWN]c[SHIFT UP][CTRL UP]
**** Ok, Logged In.  Now, are we grabbing all rules, or only specific rules? ****
**** All Rules has a value.  We need to either engage all the Fails/Warnings or All Items ****
**** All Rules Not Selected, Assuming Specific Rule(s) selected.****
**** We will need to march right through the spreadsheet and get each rule. ****
**** Looping through Column H until the end of the rules.  Rule list might vary, so this must remain a variable. ****
**** RuleArray(position) contains the text on the page we are going to have to search for ****
**** Next, do we expand the rule for Failures and Warnings only or  always expand? ****
**** We only want the failures and warnings for this rule. ****
**** Javascript Command Pseudo: Find the rule text, then check the status icon.  ****
**** If the image link (src) is Stop (Fail) or Alert (Warn), go to the arrow link and click it. ****
**** Expand the value for this rule always. ****
**** Javascript Command Pseudo: Find the rule text (if it exists), then go to the arrow link associated with it and click it  ****
**** This will open another window to download.  We're going to set the file name there. ****
Please enter the conditional commands here.
RPA005 RMC Aladdin Reports -Error: Save As Window Never Appears

value.expression:
Hello, 

Error:Save As Window Does Not Appear 

The RMC Aladdin Reports (RPA005) bot did not complete successfully due to an error attempting tp save a report on the site.  This is likely an issue with the Developer Console in Chrome not starting correctly.  Please check Chrome by logging onto Production, opening Chrome and then opening the Developer Console to see if there are any problems.
